elfarol

Class AgentWeighted

  • java.lang.Object
    • elfarol.AgentWeighted
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agent

    public class AgentWeighted
extends java.lang.Object
implements Agent
    Defines an agent of the El Farol simulation.

    Agents have a list of strategies (see AStrategy) and each turn they try to predict the attendance level of the bar for the current time step, and determine if they attend to the bar or not.

    Since:
    2.0-beta, 2011
    See Also:
    AStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • isAttending

        public boolean isAttending()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        Returns the value of attend.
        Specified by:
        isAttending in interface Agent
        Returns:
        true if the agent attends the bar in the current time step (if called after the Agent.updateAttendance() function); false otherwise

      • score

        protected double score(elfarol.strategies.AStrategy strategy)
        Evaluates the fitness value of the specified strategy based on the current knowledge of the agent (i.e., based on the current state recorded in the memory of the agent).

        The smaller value returned by this function the better the strategy is. The value is constructed by summing up the differences between the actual and predicted value the past memorySize weeks based on the current strategy. The predicted value is determined by the predictAttendance(AStrategy, List) function.

        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy to evaluate; cannot be null
        Returns:
        the difference between the predicted and actual attendance level of the last memorySize weeks; non-negative

      • predictAttendance

        protected double predictAttendance(elfarol.strategies.AStrategy strategy,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> subhistory)
        Returns the predicted attendance level of the bar with the specified strategy for the given history time window.

        It uses an autoregressive model with c = 1. Prediction is determined by the function requires the current strategy and the list of attendance values preceding the weekth element of history. Formally, the function should return the following value p(t) prediction described in the original model: 

         p(t) = w(t) + sum_{i=t-1}^{t-M}w(i)*a(i-1)

        where t is the current time, w(i) is the weight, a(i) is the attendance level and M is the memory size.

        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy to predict the attendance with
        subhistory - the time window of the history to create a prediction from
        Returns:
        the prediction based on the previous attendance levels based on the described formulae

      • updatePredictions

        public void updatePredictions()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        Scheduled update method for the agent's predictions. This is called by the model every tick prior to Agent.updateAttendance() and can be used to update the agent's beliefs prior to making predictions. Agents which do not require scheduled beliefs updating do nothing when this method is called.
        Specified by:
        updatePredictions in interface Agent

      • updateAttendance

        public void updateAttendance()
        Makes the agent update its attendance level based on its attendance prediction by its best evaluated strategy.
        Specified by:
        updateAttendance in interface Agent
